Select the option that is related to the fifth number in the same way as the second number is related to the first number and the fourth number is related to the third number.

19 : 34 :: 5 : 6 :: 27 : ?

 50 67 52 63

The logic followed here is :-

(First number × 2) - 4

  • 19 : 34 → (19 × 2) - 4 = 38 - 4 = 34

and

  • 5 : 6 → (5 × 2) - 4 = 10 - 4 = 6

Similarly,

  • 27 : ? → (27 × 2) - 4 = 54 - 4 = 50

Hence, the correct answer is "50".

Which two signs should be interchanged to make the given equation correct?

171 ÷ 3 – 16 + 72 × 412 = 572

 × and – ÷ and – ÷ and + – and +

The logic followed here is :-

By using BODMAS RULE :

Option 1) : × and –

Given equation is : 171 ÷ 3 – 16 + 72 × 412 = 572 

After interchanging the two signs the equation is as follows : 171 ÷ 3 × 16 + 72 - 412 = 572

⇒ 171 ÷ 3 × 16 + 72 - 412 = 572

⇒ 57 × 16 + 72 - 412 = 572

⇒ 912 + 72 - 412 = 572

⇒ 984 - 412 = 572

⇒ 572 = 572

LHS = RHS

Option 2) : ÷ and –

Given equation is : 171 ÷ 3 – 16 + 72 × 412 = 572 

After interchanging the two signs the equation is as follows : 171 - 3 ÷ 16 + 72 × 412 = 572

⇒ 171 - 3 ÷ 16 + 72 × 412 = 572

⇒ 171 - 0.1875 + 72 × 412 = 572

⇒ 171 - 0.1875 + 29664 = 572

⇒ 29835 - 0.1875 = 572

⇒ 29834.1875 ≠ 572

LHS ≠ RHS

Option 3) : ÷ and +

Given equation is : 171 ÷ 3 – 16 + 72 × 412 = 572 

After interchanging the two signs the equation is as follows : 171 + 3 - 16 ÷ 72 × 412 = 572

⇒171 + 3 - 16 ÷ 72 × 412 = 572

⇒171 + 3 - 0.22 × 412 = 572

⇒171 + 3 - 91.55 = 572

⇒174 - 91.55 = 572

⇒82.44 ≠ 572

LHS ≠ RHS

Option 4) : – and +

Given equation is : 171 ÷ 3 – 16 + 72 × 412 = 572 

After interchanging the two signs the equation is as follows : 171 ÷ 3 + 16 - 72 × 412 = 572

⇒ 171 ÷ 3 + 16 - 72 × 412 = 572

⇒ 57 + 16 - 72 × 412 = 572

⇒ 57 + 16 - 29664 = 572

⇒ 73 - 29664 = 572

⇒ -29591 ≠ 572

LHS ≠ RHS

Hence, the correct answer is "× and –".

Which two signs should be interchanged to make the given equation correct?

17 × 4 + 6 ÷ 2 – 27 = 92

 + and × ÷ and × + and - ÷ and +

The logic followed here is :-

By using BODMAS RULE :

Option 1) : + and ×

Given equation is : 17 × 4 + 6 ÷ 2 – 27 = 92

After interchanging the two signs the equation is as follows : 17 + 4 × 6 ÷ 2 - 27 = 92

⇒ 17 + 4 × 6 ÷ 2 - 27 = 92

⇒ 17 + 4 × 3 - 27 = 92

⇒ 17 + 12 - 27 = 92

⇒ 29 - 27 = 92

⇒ 2 ≠ 92

LHS ≠ RHS

Option 2) : ÷ and ×

Given equation is : 17 × 4 + 6 ÷ 2 – 27 = 92

After interchanging the two signs the equation is as follows : 17 ÷ 4 + 6 × 2 - 27 = 92

⇒ 17 ÷ 4 + 6 × 2 - 27 = 92

⇒ 4.25 + 6 × 2 - 27 = 92

⇒ 4.25 + 12 - 27 = 92

⇒ 16.25 - 27 = 92

⇒ 10.75 ≠ 92

LHS ≠ RHS

Option 3) : + and -

Given equation is : 17 × 4 + 6 ÷ 2 – 27 = 92

After interchanging the two signs the equation is as follows: 17 × 4 - 6 ÷ 2 + 27 = 92

⇒ 17 × 4 - 6 ÷ 2 + 27 = 92

⇒ 17 × 4 - 3 + 27 = 92

⇒ 68 - 3 + 27 = 92

⇒ 95 - 3 = 92

⇒ 92 = 92

LHS = RHS

Option 4) : ÷ and +

Given equation is : 17 × 4 + 6 ÷ 2 – 27 = 92

After interchanging the two signs the equation is as follows : 17 × 4 ÷ 6 + 2 - 27 = 92

⇒ 17 × 4 ÷ 6 + 2 - 27 = 92

⇒ 17 × 0.66 + 2 - 27 = 92

⇒ 11.33 + 2 - 27 = 92

⇒ 13.33 - 27 = 92

⇒ 13.66 ≠ 92

LHS ≠ RHS

Hence, the correct answer is "+ and -".

 2 The Shevaroy Hills are located in which state of India? Chhattisgarh Odisha Rajasthan Tamil Nadu

The correct answer is Tamil Nadu. 

Key Points

  • The Shevaroy Hills is a mountain range located in the Eastern Ghats of Tamil Nadu.
  • It is situated near the town of Yercaud, which is a popular tourist destination known for its scenic beauty and pleasant weather.
  • The Shevaroy Hills are home to a variety of flora and fauna, including several rare and endangered species of plants and animals.
  • The hills are also known for their coffee and spice plantations, which are a major source of livelihood for the local communities.

Additional Information

  • The Eastern Ghats run almost parallel to the east coast of India leaving broad plains between their base and the coast.
  • It is a chain of highly broken and detached hills starting from the Mahanadi in Odisha to the Vagai in Tamil Nadu.
  • They almost disappear between the Godavari and the Krishna.
  • The Eastern Ghats reappear as more or less a continuous hill range in Cuddapah and Kurnool districts of Andhra Pradesh where they are called as Nallamala Range with a general elevation of 600-850 m.
    • Located south of the Krishna River, the hills run north to south, parallel to the Coromandel Coast on the Bay of Bengal.
    • The rugged, sparsely populated hills are composed for the most part of jumbled quartzites and slates and exemplify the mountain scenery of the Eastern Ghats.
  • The southern part of this range is called the Palkonda range.
    • The hills trend northwest to southeast and form the central part of the Eastern Ghats.
    • Geologically, they are relicts of ancient mountains formed during the Cambrian Period that were subsequently eroded by the Penneru River and its tributaries.
  • Javadi Hills, range of hills, one of the larger of the Eastern Ghats, in northern Tamil Nadu state, southeastern India.
    • Their steep southeastern flanks are forested with sandalwood.
    • The hills are sparsely populated.
    • Grains, legumes, and oilseeds are the chief crops.
 3 In India Who among the following has the power to pardon, reprieve or commute the punishment of any criminal? Prime Minister Attorney General of India President Vice-President

The Correct answer is PresidentKey PointsPardoning Power of President

  • Article 72 empowers the President the power to grant pardons, reprieves, respites, or remissions of punishment or to suspend, remit or commute the sentence of any person convicted of any offence.
  • The meaning of these terms is as follows:
    • Pardon: It removes both the sentence and the conviction and completely absolves the convict from all sentences, punishments, and disqualifications.
    • Commutation: It denotes the substitution of one form of punishment with a lighter form of punishment. For example, a death sentence may be commuted to rigorous imprisonment.
    • Remission: It implies reducing the period of the sentence without changing its character. For example, a sentence of rigorous imprisonment for five years may be remitted to rigorous imprisonment for one year.
    • Respite: It denotes awarding a lesser sentence in place of one originally awarded due to some special fact, such as the physical disability of a convict or the pregnancy of a woman offender.
    • Reprieve: It implies a stay of the execution of a sentence (especially that of death) for a temporary period. Its purpose is to enable the convict to have time to seek pardon or commutation from the President.

2 The “Nalacharitam” play is associated with which Indian dance form? Kathak Kathakali Sattriya Odissi

The correct answer is Kathakali.

Key Points

  • Nalacharitam is a play that originated in the state of Kerala, which is known for its rich cultural heritage and traditional dance forms.
  • The play Nalacharitam is a popular performance in Kathakali, which tells the story of King Nala and his struggles.​

Important Points

  • Kathakali is a classical Indian dance form which is a story play genre of art is the folk dance form of Kerala.
  • It is a combination of 5 forms of fine art which are –
    • Natyam (expressions)
    • Nritham (dance)
    • Nrithyam (enactment) 
    • Sangeetam (music)
    • Vadya (instruments)
  • Various costumes of characters of Kathakali –
    • Sathwika (Hero)
    • Katti (Villain)
    • Minukku (females)
    • Thathi (other characters)
  • Types of Drums used in Kathakali – Maddalam, Chenda, and Idakka
  • Kathakali is the most difficult style of the traditional dance form in which actors speak ‘sign language’ where hand gestures are used to dictate word part of the character and facial and eye movements express emotions and mood.
  • Kathakali is based on the epics of Ramayana and Mahabharata. 

Additional Information

  • Kathak, on the other hand, is a classical dance form that originated in North India and is known for its intricate footwork and graceful movements.
  • Sattriya is a classical dance form from the state of Assam.
  • Odissi is a classical dance form from the state of Odisha.
 1 The President of which country attended the first Republic Day celebrations of India as its chief guest? Bhutan Indonesia China Japan

The correct answer is Indonesia

Key Points
  • The first Republic Day Parade was held on 26 January 1950, during which the President of Indonesia Sukarno was the chief guest.
  • Between 1950 and 1954, Republic Day parades were held at Irwin Stadium (now National Stadium), Kingsway, Red Fort and Ramlila Maidan.

Which of the following pair of compound – melting point is correct?

I. Acetic acid – 290K

II. Ethanol – 156K

 Only I Both I and II Neither I nor II Only II

The correct answer is Both I and II.

Key Points Ethanol

  • Ethanol is still a liquid at room temperature, and it has a melting point of 156 K and a boiling point of 351 K.
  • It is used as a preservative in paints because it is an efficient solvent and often used in cleaning materials to prevent breach of organisms.
  • It is used in gasoline to avoid piston knocking and to preserve driveability.
  • It is a strong, water-mixable solvent containing other organic solvents, including acetone, tetrachloride carbon, ethylene glycol, chloroform, benzene, diethyl alcohol, glycerol, pyridine, nitromethane, and toluene.

Acetic acid

  • Acetic acid is an organic compound that belongs to a group of acids called carboxylic acids.
  • The formula of acetic acid is CH3COOH with a methyl group is attached to a carboxyl functional group.
  • The melting point of acetic acid is 290 K or 16.5°C and hence it often freezes during winter in cold climates.
  • The IUPAC name of acetic acid is ethanoic acid. Acetic acid is the main component of vinegar.
  • 5-8% solution of acetic acid in water is called vinegar and is used widely as a preservative in pickles.
  • Vinegar's sour taste and pungent smell are due to the presence of acetic acid.
  • Uses of Acetic Acid:
    • Acetic acid is used in the production of a wide range of dyes, rayons, silk, and perfumes.
    • Acetic acid is also used in the production of rubber.
    • It is mostly used in a pickle preservative as vinegar.
    • It is injected directly into the tumour during cancer treatment.
  • Therefore Both I and II are correct.

1 In India, what type of unemployment is created due to lack of employable skills among the educated youths in India? Structural unemployment Educated unemployment Cyclical unemployment Technological unemployment

The correct answer is Educated unemployment.

Key Points

  • Educated unemployment refers to the situation where individuals who have acquired higher education and skills are unable to find suitable employment opportunities.
  • This type of unemployment is prevalent in India due to the mismatch between the skills possessed by the educated youths and the demands of the job market.

Additional Information

  • Structural unemployment is arises from long-term changes in the economy and technology, requiring workers to shift to new sectors or acquire new skills. While skill mismatch can contribute to structural unemployment, it's a broader phenomenon not solely focused on educational gaps.
  • Cyclical unemployment is caused by fluctuations in the business cycle, where there is a decrease in demand for goods and services, leading to layoffs and unemployment.
  • Technological unemployment is caused by the automation of jobs, where machines and technology replace human labor.

Additional Information

  • Lingayats continue to be an important community in the region to date.
  • They worship Shiva in his manifestation as a linga, and men usually wear a small linga in a silver case on a loop strung over the left shoulder.
  • Those who are revered include the jangama or wandering monks.
  • Lingayats believe that on death the devotee will be united with Shiva and will not return to this world.
  • Therefore they do not practise funerary rites such as cremation, prescribed in the Dharmashastras.

 1 Which amendment of Indian Constitution removed the right to property from the list of fundamental rights? 41st 42nd 43rd 44th

  • This amendment was made to prevent the misuse of the right to property by individuals and to ensure that it is used for the welfare of society as a whole.
  • Hence, the right to property is no longer a fundamental right, however, it is still a constitutional right.​

Additional Information Fundamental Rights:

  • Supreme Court is the custodian or protector of fundamental rights.

  • Articles:
    • Right to equality (14 - 18)
    • Right to freedom (19 - 22)
    • Right against exploitation (23 - 24)
    • Right to freedom of religion(25 - 28)
    • Cultural and educational rights (29 - 30)
    • Right to constitutional remedies (32)

 3 What happens to the guard cells when water flows into them? The guard cells close. Stomatal pores open. Stomatal pores shrink. Stomatal pores close.

The correct answer is Stomatal pores open.

Key Points

  • Stomata are tiny pores present on the surface of the leaves.
  • Massive amounts of gaseous exchange take place in the leaves through these pores for the purpose of photosynthesis.
  • But it is important to note here that the exchange of gases occurs across the surface of stems, roots, and leaves as well.
  • Since large amounts of water can also be lost through these stomata, the plant closes these pores when it does not need carbon dioxide for photosynthesis.
  • The opening and closing of the pore is a function of the guard cells.
  • The guard cells swell when water flows into them, causing the stomatal pore to open. Similarly, the pore closes if the guard cells shrink.

The question consists of two statements, namely, Assertion (A) and Reason (R). Use them to choose the correct alternative.

Assertion (A): During the British rule, India’s exports exceeded the imports leading to surplus of balance of trade.

Reason (R): The surplus of balance of trade was used for growth and development of India.

 Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A Both A and R are true, but R is not the correct explanation of A A is false but R is true A is true and R is false

The correct answer is A is true and R is false.

Key Points

Explanation:

Assertion (A): India did indeed have a surplus in its balance of trade during most of the British Raj.

  • This means that the value of its exports exceeded the value of its imports.
  • This was due to several factors, including:
    • Forced cultivation of cash crops: The British forced Indian farmers to grow crops like indigo and cotton for export, even if it meant neglecting food production for domestic consumption.
    • Deindustrialization: British policies destroyed India's traditional industries, making the country more dependent on imported manufactured goods.
    • Drain of wealth: A significant portion of the trade surplus was not reinvested in India, but sent back to Britain as tribute and profits for British companies.

Reason (R): However, the statement that the surplus of the balance of trade was used for the growth and development of India is false.

  • The benefits of the trade surplus primarily accrued to the British, while India suffered from:
    • Underdevelopment: The drain of wealth and focus on cash crops over food production stunted India's economic development and exacerbated poverty.
    • Exploitation: Indian farmers and laborers were often exploited by British companies and landowners, receiving meager wages and working in poor conditions.
    • Lack of infrastructure: Despite the trade surplus, the British invested very little in India's infrastructure, such as roads, railways, and education, which further hampered development.
 

Therefore, while it is true that India had a positive balance of trade under British rule, the surplus was not used for its growth and development, but rather benefited the British at the expense of the Indian people.

 3 What would happen if the difference in pressure in Tahiti was negative? Above average late monsoon Drought Below average and late monsoon Above average and early monsoon

The correct answer is 'Below average and late monsoon'

Key Points

  • Difference in pressure in Tahiti:
    • The pressure difference in the Southern Oscillation Index (SOI) is an indicator of the El Niño-Southern Oscillation (ENSO) phenomenon, which greatly influences climatic conditions globally.
    • When the pressure difference in Tahiti is negative, it typically signals the presence of an El Niño event, which is characterized by warmer ocean temperatures in the central and eastern Pacific Ocean.
    • El Niño often leads to a weaker monsoon system in India, resulting in lower rainfall and a delayed monsoon season.
    • Thus, a negative pressure difference in Tahiti correlates with monsoon anomalies such as below-average rainfall and delayed onset of the monsoon in India.

Additional Information

  • Above average late monsoon:
    • This option suggests an inconsistency in the monsoon pattern, as "above average" generally indicates higher rainfall, while "late monsoon" refers to the timing. El Niño conditions generally lead to lower, not higher, rainfall, thus making this option incorrect.
  • Drought:
    • While El Niño can cause drought conditions in certain regions, the term "drought" is too broad. The more accurate description pertinent to the Indian monsoon context involves specifics about below-average and delayed rainfall rather than outright drought.
  • Above average and early monsoon:
    • This option misrepresents typical El Niño effects, which usually bring weaker and delayed monsoons, not stronger or early ones. Hence, it does not align with the climatic impacts of a negative pressure difference in Tahiti.

 2 If the measure of one angle of a right triangle is 30° more than the measure of the smallest angle, then the measure of the smallest angle is: 90° 60° 30° 75°

Given:

The Right-angle triangle

Concept:

The sum of all angles of right-angle triangle = 180° 

One of the angles of the Right-angle triangle = 90° 

Calculation:

Let the smallest angle of the right-angle triangle be X

According to the question

The second angle = X + 30

The sum of all angles of the right-angle triangle = X + X + 30° + 90° 

⇒ 180° = 2X + 120

⇒ 180° - 120° = 2X

⇒ 60° = 2X

⇒ X = 30° 

∴ The required result will be 30°.

How many of the following numbers are divisible by 3 but NOT by 9?

5826, 5964, 6039, 6336, 6489, 6564, 6867 and 6960

 5 3 4 6

Given:

The number = 5826, 5964, 6039, 6336, 6489, 6564, 6867, and 6960

Concept:

Direction: Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.

We are organising the charity function tomorrow.

 The charity function is been organised tomorrow. The charity function is being organised tomorrow. The charity function is being organise tomorrow. The charity function is organised tomorrow.

The correct answer is "The charity function is being organised tomorrow."

Key Points

  • The given sentence is in the Present Continuous Tense and in Active Voice.
  • The rule for changing a Present Continuous Tense from Active voice to Passive voice or Passive to Active Voice:
  • Interchange the object and subject with each other, i.e. object of the active sentence become the subject of the passive sentence.
  • Structure:
    • Subject + is/am/are + v1 + ing+ object (Active Voice)
    • Object + is/am/are + being + V3 + by Subject (Passive Voice)
  • Example:
    • Esha is singing a song. (Active Voice)
    • A song is being sung by Esha. (Passive Voice)
  • The subject of the given sentence is 'We.'​​
  • The object of the given sentence is 'Charity function.'
  • The subject will be put in place of the object and the object will be put in place of the subject.
  • 'Is organising' will be changed into 'is being organised.'
  • "Charity function" is a singular noun so we must "is" with it.
  • The correct answer is option 2.

Direction: In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Read the passage carefully and select the most appropriate option to fill in each blank.

Colonialism had a great impact on the lives of the aboriginal Australians who were eventually ______ (1) ______ by the whites with all power and privilege. An increase in deforestation and destruction of traditional land led ______ (5) ______ like emu, eagle, and kangaroo, among many others to dwindle over time.

 Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 3. created perceived received led The correct answer is "perceived."

Key Points

  • The word "perceived" is appropriate for the blank because it indicates that the characterization of the aborigines as sub-humans with low status and dirty habits is not necessarily an accurate or objective representation.
  • "Perceived" means to notice or realize something. (इंद्रियों द्वारा ग्रहण करना, देखना, जानना, बोध होना)
  • Instead, it suggests that these beliefs were based on subjective viewpoints, stereotypes, or biased perspectives held by others.
  • Therefore, the​ correct answer is Option 2.

Colonialism had a great impact on the lives of the aboriginal Australians who were eventually subjugated by the whites with all power and privilege. The whites not only displaced the tribes off their homeland but also ______ (4) ______ the beauty and balance of the natural world. An increase in deforestation and destruction of traditional land led ______ (5) ______ like emu, eagle, and kangaroo, among many others to dwindle over time.

Additional Information

  • Created: to cause something new to happen or exist. (कुछ नया उत्‍पन्‍न, रचना, बनाना, करना; अस्तित्व में लाना)
  • Received: to get or accept something that somebody sends or gives to you. (प्राप्‍त या स्‍वीकार करना (दूसरे के द्वारा भेजी या दी गई वस्‍तु को))
  • Led: to go with or in front of a person or animal to show the way or to make him/her/it go in the right direction. (किसी व्‍यक्ति या पशु को साथ ले जाना या उसे रास्‍ता दिखाना या सही दिशा में भेजना)

Direction: In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Read the passage carefully and select the most appropriate option to fill in each blank.

 Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 5. fauna pets thugs homies The correct answer is "fauna."

Key Points

  • The word "fauna" is suitable for the blank because it refers to the animal species in a particular region or environment. (किसी विशेष क्षेत्र या वातावरण में जानवरों की प्रजातियाँ)
  • In this context, the sentence suggests that the increase in deforestation and destruction of traditional land has led to a decline in animal species such as emu, eagle, and kangaroo.
  • Therefore, the​ correct answer is Option 1.
